amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for homeless assistance grants by $184 million and funding for FEMA emergency management planning and assistance by $30 million, and reduce FEMA disaster relief funding by $235 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed in the Congressional Record of July 26 as amendment No. 69, to cut $235 million from FEMA disaster assistance; adds $184 million for homeless assistance grants and adds $30 million for FEMA's emergency food and shelter program.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Vento amendment (A011) Failed by recorded vote: 160 - 260 (Roll no. 594).
